title: Chris Rock to host 2016 Oscar broadcast
text:
Chris Rock to host 2016 Oscar broadcast Chris Rock to host 2016 Oscar broadcast Share 
Chris Rock is returning to host the Oscars for a second time. 
The show’s producers David Hill and Reginald Hudlin have said the funnyman will take the duties for the 88th Academy Awards on February 28, 2016. 
— Chris Rock (@chrisrock) October 21, 2015 
Chris, who previously hosted the Oscars ceremony in 2005 and presented an award at the 2012 event, said: “I’m so glad to be hosting the Oscars. It’s great to be back.” 
The show’s producers called Chris “the MVP of the entertainment industry”, adding: “Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, documentarian – he’s done it all. He’s going to be a phenomenal Oscar host.” 
Chris, who has won four Emmy Awards for his comedy series and specials, recently directed the comedy special Amy Schumer: Live At The Apollo for HBO. 
The former Saturday Night Live castmate wrote, directed and starred in the feature Top Five in 2014, and produced, wrote and starred in the 2009 documentary Good Hair. Share article 
The 2016 Oscars will be held at the Dolby Theatre at Hollywood and Highland Centre in Hollywood. Promoted Stories
